questions.question: What is the empirical formula of L-Ba-Fe28?
What is the percentage weight loss corresponding to the combustion of organic ligands in D-Ba-Fe28?
Does the IR spectrum of L-Ca-Fe28 indicate stability in its structure?
What is the role of chiral co-anions in the self-assembly process of Fe28 clusters?
questions.answer: Chiral co-anions selectively suppress the self-assembly process of one of the enantiomers.

questions.question: Is the effective charge of D-Fe28 higher than L-Fe28?
What method was used to separate the enantiomers from their racemic mixtures?
What is the crystal system of L-Ca-Fe28?
What does the SAXS curve of Ca-L-Fe28 indicate about its structure in solution?
questions.answer: The SAXS curve indicates that the wheel-structure of Ca-L-Fe28 remains stable in solution.

questions.question: Is the self-assembly speed of Fe28 clusters concentration dependent?
What does the presence of D-lactic acid in the buffer solution do to the self-assembly of D-Fe28?
questions.answer: It suppresses the self-assembly of D-Fe28.

questions.question: What is the calculated value for {H7Ba3*Fe28}7- in ESI results of Ba-Fe28?
Does the addition of chiral co-anions affect the size of the blackberry structures formed?
What is the role of counterions in the self-assembly of Fe28 clusters?
questions.answer: Counterions mediate the attraction in confined spaces between the clusters.

questions.question: What is the effect of L-lactic acid on the self-assembly of L-Fe28?
questions.answer: L-lactic acid suppresses the self-assembly of L-Fe28.

questions.question: Is the self-assembly process of Fe28 clusters affected by the presence of chiral organic molecules?
What is the goodness-of-fit on F2 for D-Ca-Fe28?
What does the study of Fe28 clusters' self-assembly in the presence of chiral co-anions demonstrate?
questions.answer: It demonstrates the significance of co-anions in chiral selection during the self-assembly process.

questions.question: Can the self-assembly of Fe28 clusters lead to the formation of homogeneous blackberry structures in their racemic mixture solutions?
What is the role of chiral microenvironments in the self-assembly of Fe28 clusters?
questions.answer: Chiral microenvironments determine the rate of self-assembly by affecting the activation energy for dimer/oligomer formation.

questions.question: What does the presence of D/L-lactic acid in the buffer solution do to the self-assembly of Fe28 clusters?
questions.answer: It leads to a natural chiral selection and chiral amplification process.
